arm_group.description: IV sedation dose calculated using current standard of care
IV sedation dose calculated by study algorithm

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aims to compare an algorithm for IV sedation dosing to the current standard of
      care in patients undergoing first trimester surgical abortion.  The primary outcome is
      subjects' pain score with suction curettage on a 0-100 21-point scale.  Secondary outcomes
      include pain scores with cervical dilation and 15 minutes post-procedure, subjective pain
      ratings, incidents of side effects and adverse events, the frequency of additional doses of
      medication, recovery room time, and physician assessment of and satisfaction with pain
      control.  Investigators hypothesize that this algorithm will result in improved pain
      control, decreased frequency of additional medication doses, improved patient and physician
      satisfaction, without differences in side effects, adverse events or recovery room time.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of an Algorithm to Determine IV Sedation Dosing During First-trimester Surgical Abortion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women age 18 or older seeking surgical abortion at Planned Parenthood League of
             Massachusetts (PPLM)

          -  Gestational age less than or equal to 13+6, confirmed by ultrasound

          -  Eligible for surgical abortion according to PPLM protocols

          -  Eligible for IV sedation per PPLM protocol, and desiring IV sedation for pain
             management

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Choice of local anesthesia for pain control

          -  Hypersensitivity to midazolam or fentanyl

          -  Ineligible for IV sedation per PPLM protocol

          -  Need for cervical ripening with either misoprostol or mechanical priming agent
             (laminaria/Dilapan)

          -  Unable or unwilling to complete required study procedures

          -  Previous participation in the study

intervention.description: IV sedation dosing calculated by algorithm
IV sedation dosing calculated by standard care.

clinical_study.official_title: Use of an Algorithm to Determine IV Sedation Dosing During First-trimester Surgical Abortion

other_outcome.description: To assess whether use of the algorithm changes physician's behavior in the standard care arm, investigators will also examine doses given over the duration of the study, to see if a "learning curve" develops among the physicians based on their experience with the algorithm.
other_outcome.measure: Doses given over the duration of the study
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), intraoperatively

other_outcome.description: Investigators will also have the physician assess patients' pain control, whether they felt the dose was appropriate and how easy or difficult it was to determine the patients' doses of pain medication.
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), post-operatively

authority: United States: Data and Safety Monitoring Board

primary_outcome.description: Subjects' pain score with suction curettage on a 0-100 21-point scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), immediately (within one minute) after completion of suction curettage and speculum removal

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Pain with paracervical block will be measured (a) on a 21-point 0 to 100 scale (in increments of five), and (b) on a subjective scale of "no pain, mild pain, moderate pain or severe pain." Pain will be measured immediately after paracervical block.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), immediately after paracervical block

secondary_outcome.description: Pain with cervical dilation will be measured (a) on a 21-point 0 to 100 scale (in increments of five), and (b) on a subjective scale of "no pain, mild pain, moderate pain or severe pain."  Pain with cervical dilation will be measured immediately after cervical dilation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), immediately after cervical dilation

secondary_outcome.description: Post-operative pain will be measured (a) on a 21-point 0 to 100 scale (in increments of five), and (b) on a subjective scale of "no pain, mild pain, moderate pain or severe pain."  Pain will be measured 15 minutes post-operatively when the patient is in the recovery room.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), 15 minutes post-operatively

secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be asked about their general satisfaction with pain control, what their pain was compared to what they expected, whether they would chose the same pain management strategy again, and whether they would recommend their strategy of pain management to a friend.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), 15 minutes post-operatively

secondary_outcome.description: Investigators will assess side effects for all patients, including nausea, vomiting, dizziness, and drowsiness.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured on Day 1 (day of enrollment), 15 minutes post-operatively

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
